Graduate Development Program 2019 – Electrical Engineers

Company Name CitiPower and Powercor Company Location 40 Market St, Melbourne, VIC 3000, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 332 views

Job description

We are excited to announce that applications are now being accepted from Electrical Engineering students who are keen to commence in our 2019 Graduate Development Program.


If you are currently completing or recently completed a degree in Electrical Engineering, and have had a keen interest in the electrical distribution sector, we want to hear from you!

Our 3-year program is fun, challenging and rewarding and is dedicated on providing you with the right life tools, challenges, skills and hands-on experience. By joining our program, you will derive a career pathway of that leads to a technical engineering specialist or a future business leader. Our program provides you with solid business awareness – both regionally and globally - in conjunction with an opportunity to work under a variety of company disciplines.


What you will gain:\xa0\xa0\xa0


  • A\xa0valuable opportunity to put theory into practice by delivering projects and solving problems as part of a team of highly motivated professionals

  • Prospective experience on projects from start to finish and hone your technical qualifications, communication, project management, business insight and analytical skills

  • Valuable experience in high-tech disciplines such as protection and control design, protection relay application and settings, SCADA design and application, load flow analysis, system planning and station design

  • Exposure to new and emerging technology and related projects

  • Exposure to industry leading practices within the state’s leading and best performing electricity distribution company
  • Upon successful completion, you will be offered a permanent position within the business

\xa0\xa0

To Apply:


To be considered you will have completed a relevant electrical engineering tertiary qualification by the end of the 2018 academic year and be prepared to commence full-time employment during the first week of February 2019.


Applications must be lodged on-line before the closing date of COB Wednesday 19th September 2018.


Please be advised you must attach your most recent University transcript in order to be considered.


For more information on the Electrical Engineering Graduate Development program, please read our Frequently Asked Questions.


OUR VALUES: Live safely, Be Customer and Community Minded, Succeed Together, Be The Best You Can Be, Improve Our Business


CitiPower and Powercor is an Equal Opportunity Employer


\xa0

\xa0

\xa0

Job description

Joining Belimo as a Sales Estimator, you will take on an exciting role of increasing sales potential by estimiating projects with the BELIMO products.\xa0\xa0


You will be working collaboratively within a team environment and building strong client relationships. As a Sales Estimator, you will be bringing your expertise to:


  • Manage the tender process and take-offs until the successful acquisition of each project.
  • Coordinate with inter-departments in order to fulfil customer project requirements.
  • Project quoting directly or through online portals as required.
  • Documenting and analysing data to assist future tenders.


The successful applicant will possess the following characteristics:


  • Experience in tendering/project management experience in a similar field.

  • Exceptional communication skills (both written and verbal) and the ability to interact at all levels.

  • Team player who is also proactive and has a creative and solutions focused approach.

  • Attention to detail and proficiency with computers.

  • Highly organised though adaptable to change.

    \xa0

This position is ideal for a candidate with Sales experience and / or a Graduate Engineer.


If you are looking for a career that will take you further, this is your opportunity.

Sales Advisor

Company Name COS Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 7 days ago Number of views 106 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Are you looking for a rewarding job with exciting opportunities for future development? COS are currently recruiting for a dedicated sales advisor that can represent the brand in Australia. We are looking for an enthusiastic person with excellent communication skills and who enjoys working as part of a team to deliver great customer service

What does the role involve?

Every day is different at COS, however your main responsibilities will include, offering our customers a high level of service, receiving deliveries, replenishment and garment care

About COS

COS is a fashion brand for women and men who want timeless, modern, functional and considered design. Offering reinvented classics and wardrobe essentials, we create pieces that are made to last beyond the season. Since launching in 2007 we have opened over 150 stores worldwide, all in carefully considered locations applying an architectural design concept that preserves buildings’ original features whilst creating a modern, welcoming space

Our Values

Working at COS is different from many companies, particularly when it comes to our values and the way we apply them. Our values are keep it simple, believe in people, constant improvement, straightforward and open-minded, entrepreneurial spirit, cost conscious and we are one team. We believe that our values provide a framework for encouraging commitment, happiness and creating a great place to work

Why COS?

In order for COS to grow, we recognise the need to invest in our colleagues and support development. We believe in people and always promote internally wherever possible; everyone has the opportunity to progress at COS and our ongoing expansion provides great opportunities

Who are we looking for?

The Key Qualities That We Look For In Our Sales Advisors Are

We encourage diversity and welcome candidates from all backgrounds.
  • 1 years previous customer service experience(preferred)
  • Ability to work a flexible schedule (including weekends)
  • Good brand awareness
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Self-motivated
  • Adaptable
We look forward to hearing from you soon

Apply

853434624:
[

Senior Lecturer - Myotherapy

Company Name Study Group Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 7 days ago Number of views 27 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Endeavour College of Natural Health continues to offer the largest range of government accredited natural health and wellness courses within Australia to both the Higher Education and VET sectors. The highest standard of education, coupled with the most informed curriculum, has fostered the College's expansion to become Australia's pre-eminent provider of natural medicine education.


An exciting opportunity has arisen to join our passionate and friendly team, as a Higher Education Senior Lecturer in Myotherapy, on our Melbourne campus. This role is part-time (four days per week).


Working closely with the Associate Head of Department and the extended academic team, this position provides teaching and learning of the highest standard to Endeavour students.

Your primary responsibilities will include preparing and delivering lectures, tutorials, practical classes, demonstrations, workshops, student field excursions and clinical sessions using innovative, flexible and stimulating course materials for students undertaking undergraduate coursework. Maintaining current in academic, professional and industrial developments of the Myotherapy discipline area, you will contribute towards the academic and research output of the department. You will advise the Associate Head of Department on recommended program/subject and process enhancements and future direction, manage casual and permanent lecturing staff and ensure the delivery of quality program materials.


The successful candidate will hold the following:


  • A Bachelor degree in Health Science – Musculoskeletal Therapy, Myotherapy, Physiotherapy, Osteopathy, or other manual therapy equivalent
  • Post-graduate qualifications in a relevant field
  • Extensive clinical practice experience (minimum 5 years)
  • Membership to one or more relevant professional associations
  • Significant teaching experience in their field of expertise


Contract Type: Continuous/ongoing

Working pattern: 0.8 FTE (four days per week)

Location: Melbourne campus


For more information please contact Taylor-Jane Sharouni at\xa0TJ.Sharouni@endeavour.edu.au


If you are as passionate as we are about Myotherapy and neuromusculoskeletal health and would like to share your expertise with the next generation of practitioners, we would love to hear from you.


Please note:

All teaching positions require a Working with Children Check / Blue Card which must be obtained at the successful applicant's own expense prior to appointment.

Successful applicants will be required to provide qualification and registration certificates

We are only able to consider applicants who currently have the right to live and work in Australia

856353428:
[

Sales Manager (VIC/TAS)

Company Name Uniworld Boutique River Cruise Collection Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 6 days ago Number of views 128 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

The Role

Reporting to the Head of Sales, this is a rare opportunity to join an exceptional team. You will be responsible for maximising the sales potential within your designated territory by fostering and developing strong relationships with our B2B trade partners, driving Uniworld and U by Uniworld brand USP’s and experience, and building a strong business development pipeline of new agency partners.


Key responsibilities include but are not limited to:

  • Develop and implement territory business plans with key accounts using a customized approach to address their specific needs.
  • Strengthen relationships and achieve growth with key accounts through regular contact and informative updates with respect to their productivity and progress; offer assistance when appropriate to assist in achievement of their goals.
  • Provide robust training opportunities for agents through weekly trainings, client presentations, product information sessions and ongoing website and e-commerce strategies;
  • Ensure that marketing collateral is utilized to its fullest potential; ensure that Uniworld has prominent placement in key account agencies. Effectively manage brochure supply and regional distribution.
  • Identify and develop new business opportunities.

  • Evaluate ROI of potential trade and consumer shows/events and participate where beneficial. Continually identify new shows/events that would be beneficial to the brand


With a passion for luxury experiential travel, and your mastery of consultative sales to effectively connect to your business partners, you confidently execute your sales plan and achieve guest objectives / goals and sales targets. As the success driven Sales Manager for Victoria/Tasmania, you are the elegant, energetic and articulate embodiment of the brand values and ethos to the travel industry, to our prospective and past guests, and external and internal stakeholders.


The Candidate

We’re looking for an experienced Sales Manager with a true passion and appreciation for luxury travel. The successful candidate will be self-motivated, have strong time management skills, great presentation skills, tenacity, resilience and a clear focus on results.

More than likely, the successful candidate will have travel industry experience and some prior knowledge of cruise distribution and will also have the ability to successfully work with a millennial audience for U by Uniworld as well as the baby boomer target market for Uniworld.


In return, we will provide a competitive salary, a fully maintained company vehicle, an industry best sales incentive plan, access to great travel benefits, a collegiate working environment and investment in your learning and development. If this is of interest to you, then APPLY NOW!

Developer

Company Name Xero Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 7 days ago Number of views 284 views

Job description

Developer


Are you Passionate about Technology?

Do you take pride in your work?

Do you enjoy working in cross-functional teams?

About Xero


Here at Xero we are all about people and building beautiful experiences for our customers. Join our passionate team of technologists who love to learn and get involved in the community. We focus on developing solutions to make it easier for small businesses to grow through beautiful accounting software. With us you have a chance to have an impact on the lives and businesses of people globally.


Working at Xero will provide you with a diverse and inclusive environment alongside people who will respect, challenge, support and mentor you to have fun while you do the best work of your life. We are a place where personal development, innovation, and change are not only inspired but also celebrated. We value our people and want them to enjoy and take pride in their work.


About the role


You will work with your cross-functional team to deliver beautiful software that is valuable to our customers. You will have a willingness to learn, offer your ideas and collaborate to provide technical designs you are proud of. We inspire you to show your real passion for technology, help and inspire others in Xero and within the community we support.


We will offer you flexible working hours and arrangements that enable you to balance your life and passions. We trust you to build to the best of your ability and will support your dream for continual learning with training and career mentorship to help you flourish.


About you


We are looking for a passionate developer and just as important as the technical experience is the ability to be #human and take ownership of your environment. We are so lucky to have excellent people to work with and offices to work in and we'd love you to be a part of it.


So for you to be successful in this role you'll ideally have some experience with:

  • JavaScript - front end frameworks like React or Angular (we use React)

  • CSS and HTML

  • C# , WebApi and/or MVC

  • Continuous integration and automated deployment systems

  • Python or other data science related languages

  • Version control like Git

  • unit testing

  • cloud-based infrastructure (we use AWS)

  • modern patterns and coding practices

  • Agile methods and concepts


Xero is an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity, foster innovation and reward success.


If you want to come to work with friends every single day and help to make Xero even more special, please apply!

851683359:
[

SAP Business Analyst

Company Name Seqirus Company Location Parkville, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 336 views

Job description

Starting a century ago, CSL made a promise to save lives and protect the health of people stricken with a range of serious and chronic medical conditions. Today that same promise has never been stronger. Seqirus, a CSL group company, manufactures and in-licenses, markets and distributes specialty pharmaceuticals and vaccines for the prevention and treatment of serious disease. Seqirus is a major contributor to the prevention and control of influenza globally. \xa0

\xa0

If the challenges of tomorrow inspire you, if you can push boundaries while promoting proven approaches; If you think great ideas can come from anywhere so everyone's voice should be heard; If you believe a successful company can be profitable and compassionate, Seqirus is for you!

\xa0

There are 3 roles available:

1. SAP Quality & Logistics Business Analyst, responsible for support and oversight of the SAP Quality and Logistics Functions. Reporting to the Global SAP Quality & Logistics Lead.

2. SAP Manufacturing Business Analyst is responsible for support and oversight of the SAP Manufacturing and Engineering Function. Reporting to the Global SAP Manufacturing Lead.

3. SAP Finance Regional Business Analyst is responsible for support and oversight of the SAP Finance systems and processes. Reporting to the SAP Finance Lead.
\xa0

With a focus on understanding business process and translating that into technical requirements, the business analyst will be required to drive both issue resolution and project delivery, including optimization initiatives. This role is will also perform a local SAP architect function, partnering with the assigned functions to provide consultancy for system and process improvements whilst ensuring that global template standards are maintained.

Will be based in Seqirus’s head office in Parkville, Melbourne – Australia

\xa0

Key Responsibilities:

  • Understand all SAP issues and relating to Quality and Logistics/ Manufacturing and Engineering/ Finance systems and processes.
  • Escalate, where needed, to leadership teams, both business and technology
  • Maintain and support the SAP Quality/ Manufacturing/ Finance business systems
  • Coordinate SAP support resources & point of escalation for critical issues on site
  • Document issues through Service Desk process – The BA team will own the issues
  • Document Functional & Technical Specification documents for technical teams to resolve issues
  • Work closely with SAP technical teams to define & implement solutions

Seqirus advises that screening including; criminal history, medical assessment, confirmation of experience, stated qualifications and other relevant checks form a part of the candidate suitability evaluation process. Where applicable, this applies to current CSL and Seqirus employees. Current Seqirus and CSL employees must notify their current manager when selected for interview for any advertised internal vacancies.

\xa0

Important notice to Employment businesses/ Agencies
Seqirus does not accept unsolicited referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact Seqirus' Talent Acquisition to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to Seqirus. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and Seqirus. In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of Seqirus. Seqirus shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site.
